character_name: Harry Potter: A 12-year-old British wizard famous for surviving his parents' murder at the hands of the evil wizard Lord Voldemort
Ron Weasley: Harry's best friend at Hogwarts and a younger member of the Weasley wizarding family.[4]
Hermione Granger: Harry's other best friend and the trio's brains.[4]
Gilderoy Lockhart: A celebrity author and the new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher at Hogwarts.[5] Hugh Grant was the first choice for the role to play Lockhart
Nearly Headless Nick: The ghost of Gryffindor House.[8]
Rubeus Hagrid: The half-giant gamekeeper at Hogwarts. Martin Bayfield portrays a young Hagrid.[4]
Filius Flitwick: The Charms teacher at Hogwarts and head of Ravenclaw.[8]
Vernon Dursley: Harry's abusive Muggle uncle
Albus Dumbledore: Headmaster of Hogwarts and one of the greatest wizards of the age.[4] Harris died shortly before the film was released.[9]
Lucius Malfoy: Draco's father and a former Hogwarts pupil of Slytherin House who now works as a school governor at Hogwarts.[10]
Madam Pomfrey: The magical Healer of the Hogwarts hospital wing.[10]
Severus Snape: The Potions teacher at Hogwarts and head of Slytherin.[8]
Minerva McGonagall: The Transfiguration teacher at Hogwarts and head of Gryffindor.[4]
